DOC.brief_summary: To assess impact e-learning course neuromuscular monitoring frequency application objective neuromuscular monitoring assessment depth neuromuscular blockade general anaesthesia secondarily incidence residual neuromuscular blockade anesthesia . We collect data prospectively 6 Danish anaesthesia department time intervention , use data Anaesthesia Information Management System ( AIMS ) . Baseline data obtain another study base data extraction procedure ( NCT02914119 ) .
DOC.brief_title: Improving Neuromuscular Monitoring Reducing Residual Neuromuscular Blockade Via E-learning
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Departments We include 6 large anaesthesia department Zealand Region Denmark . Anaesthetists We include follow anaesthesia personnel anaesthetist : nurse anaesthetist training , nurse anaesthetist , first year resident anaesthesiology , resident last 4 year train anaesthesiology , specialist consultant anaesthesia . Patients We include collect data patient undergo general anaesthesia neuromuscular blockade data collection period . Patients , eligible , i.e . undergo general anaesthesia one occasion , include analysis case every general anaesthetic receive . Exclusion criterion We exclude personnel without clinical function , i.e . administrative personnel .
